headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; MURDER TRIAL. T?? of Mrs. ??Murder of Dr. Lutener ILLNESS OF MRS. HAYS. Adjournment of the Court to Monday. COURT OF OVER AND TERMINER--Friday. The Trades. Decisions in Equity.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Hon. Judge Roosevelt. FIFTH DAY. The Jury assembled at 10 o'clock. His Honor Judge ROOSEVELT, Mr. HAYS and his counsel, and the District Attorney were present, but Mrs. HAYS did not appear. The District Attorney said:

headline.main: LABOR AND ART.; Re-Inauguration of the Crystal Palace. GREAT POPULAR DEMONSTRATION PROCESSION THROUGH THE CITY. APPEARANCE OF THE EXHIBITION. Ceremonies at the Palace. Speeches of P. T. Barnum, Henry Ward Beecher, Elihu Burritt, Rev. E. H. Chapin, Judge Campbell, Horace Greeley, Richard O'Gorman, Jr., Luther R. Marsh, Rev. T. L. Cuyler, and others.

docs.lead_paragraph: The grand Reopening of the New-York Crystal Palace took place yesterday. The occasion was all that could have been desired. The attendance was very large; the enthusiasm was undamped by fickle skies; and the speakers were numerous, pointed, brief, and happy. The exten-
docs.abstract: sp. at the re-opening of the Crystal Palace

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. CONGRESSIONAL PROCEEDINGS. President's Message. VETO OF THE INDIGENT INSANE BILL. Interesting Debate on the President's Objections. Spirited-Debtate in the House on the Rights of the Colored Race. THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS.....First Session. SENATE .... HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Numerous petitions were presented. Mr. PETIT, from the Judiciary Committee, to which was referred the resolution directing inquiry as to the, propriety of having the United States Statutes revised corrected, and properly collated, reported that it was inexpedient to legislate on the subject.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; ARRIVAL OF THE BLACK WARRIOR. Military Condition of Cuba--Black Regiments--Latest News, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Black Warrior, Capt. J. D. BULLOCH, arrived at this port yesterday morning. She brings one hundred and one passengers, and a large amount of Cotton on freight. The B. W. left Mobile on the evening of the 25th, and arrived at Havana on the evening of the 27th. After coaling, she sailed on the 28th at 5 o'clock, P. M.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE BROADWAY CALAMITY. The Coroner's Inquest---Fifth Day. Evidence of Chief Engineer Carson and Mr. Sandford. AFTERNOON SESSION. THE TURF OF 1854. FAIL OF BUILDINGS--LOSS OF LIFE

headline.main: The Eastern War--The News by Pacific.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Pacific's news is of no peculiar importance. Fighting is going on, it seems, on the whole line of the Danube, but without decisive engagements, or at least without any solution of what may be termed the great mystery of the Dobrudseha occupation.
docs.snippet: The Pacific's news is of no peculiar importance. Fighting is going on, it seems, on the whole line of the Danube, but without decisive engagements, or at least without any solution of what may be termed the great mystery of the Dobrudseha occupation.

headline.main: GREAT BRITAIN.; Parliament--Easter--Lord Mayor's Dinner--More Strikes--Mr. Addington--Polish Legion--West India Mails--Crystal Palace--Singular Bequest--Various affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Parliament was not in session. The Easter holidays had passed over much as usual. Advices from the seat of war were anxiously looked for. Lord JOHN RUSSELL, Lord PALMERSTON, and Sir HAMILTON SEYMOUR, were guests of the Lord Mayor of London, at a banquet given on Monday evening, the 17th. They each made a speech, but said little that we need repeat.

headline.main: SCIENTIFIC CONVENTION.; American Association for the Advancement of Science. EIGHTH MEETING AT WASHINGTON. FOURTH DAY--MORNING SESSION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrangements had been made for an excursion to Mt. Vernon and Alexandria to-day, but on account of the threatening appearance of the sky, at an early hour the white flag was run up from the highest turret of the Smithsonian Institution, the concerted signal that we were to remain at peace at home, the excursion being postponed until Monday.
